snippet: Li Wangyang still had a fighting spirit and was too feeble to hang himself, friends and family members say.
abstract: Friends and family members of Li Wangyang, one of China's longest-serving political prisoners who supposedly took his own life, say he was too feeble to hang himself and far too feisty to bow out of the fight for political reform; such suspicions have electrified Chinese activists, who started an online signature campaign that calls for the authorities to investigate Li's death; so far, the petition has drawn nearly 4,000 names.

byline.contributor: Jacob Fromer and Shi Da contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Li Wangyang still had a fighting spirit and was too feeble to hang himself, friends and family members say.

headline.seo: Chinese Activist’s Death Called Suicide, But Supporters Are Suspicious
headline.main: Chinese Activist’s Death Called Suicide, but Supporters Are Suspicious
headline.print_headline: Ruling in Activist’s Death Draws Suspicion in China
